item.title: Establishing the congressional budget for the United States Government for fiscal year 2004 and setting forth appropriate budgetary levels for fiscal years 2003 and 2005 through 2013.

latestAction.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

item.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 221 - 202 (Roll no. 140). (text: CR 4/10/2003 H3286)
Passed/agreed to in House: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 221 - 202 (Roll no. 140).(text: CR 4/10/2003 H3286)
The previous question was ordered without objection.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 191.
Considered as privileged matter. (consideration: CR 4/10/2003 H3279, H3286-3291)
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 24.
All points of order against the conference report and against its consideration are waived. The conference report shall be considered as read and shall be debatable for one hour.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 108-72, by Mr. Hastings (WA).
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 108-72, by Mr. Hastings (WA).

summary.text: Waives points of order to provide for the consideration of the conference report to accompany H. Con. Res. 95 (establishing the congressional budget for the United States Government for FY 2004 and setting forth appropriate budgetary levels for FY's 2003 and 2005 through 2013).

(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced in the House on April 10, 2003. The summary of that version is repeated here.)

Waives points of order to provide for the consideration of the conference report to accompany H. Con. Res. 95 (establishing the congressional budget for the United States Government for FY 2004 and setting forth appropriate budgetary levels for FY's 2003 and 2005 through 2013).

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
